  Fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for [node](http://nodejs.org). [![Build Status](https://secure.travis-ci.org/visionmedia/express.png)](http://travis-ci.org/visionmedia/express) [![Dependency Status](https://gemnasium.com/visionmedia/express.png)](https://gemnasium.com/visionmedia/express)
>>>>>>> FETCH_HEAD

```js
var express = require('express');
var app = express();

app.get('/', function(req, res){
  res.send('Hello World');
});

app.listen(3000);
```

<<<<<<< HEAD
**PROTIP** Be sure to read [Migrating from 3.x to 4.x](https://github.com/visionmedia/express/wiki/Migrating-from-3.x-to-4.x) as well as [New features in 4.x](https://github.com/visionmedia/express/wiki/New-features-in-4.x).

## Installation

    $ npm install express

## Quick Start

 The quickest way to get started with express is to utilize the executable [`express(1)`](http://github.com/expressjs/generator) to generate an application as shown below:
 
 Install the executable. The executable's major version will match Express's:
 
    $ npm install -g express-generator@3

 Create the app:

=======
## Installation

    $ npm install -g express

## Quick Start

 The quickest way to get started with express is to utilize the executable `express(1)` to generate an application as shown below:

 Create the app:

    $ npm install -g express
>>>>>>> FETCH_HEAD
    $ express /tmp/foo && cd /tmp/foo

 Install dependencies:

    $ npm install

 Start the server:

<<<<<<< HEAD
    $ npm start

## Features

=======
    $ node app

## Features

  * Built on [Connect](http://github.com/senchalabs/connect)
>>>>>>> FETCH_HEAD
  * Robust routing
  * HTTP helpers (redirection, caching, etc)
  * View system supporting 14+ template engines
  * Content negotiation
  * Focus on high performance
<<<<<<< HEAD
=======
  * Environment based configuration
>>>>>>> FETCH_HEAD
  * Executable for generating applications quickly
  * High test coverage

## Philosophy

<<<<<<< HEAD
  The Express philosophy is to provide small, robust tooling for HTTP servers, making
  it a great solution for single page applications, web sites, hybrids, or public
  HTTP APIs.

  Express does not force you to use any specific ORM or template engine. With support for over
  14 template engines via [Consolidate.js](http://github.com/visionmedia/consolidate.js),
=======
  The Express philosophy is to provide small, robust tooling for HTTP servers. Making
  it a great solution for single page applications, web sites, hybrids, or public
  HTTP APIs.

  Built on Connect you can use _only_ what you need, and nothing more, applications
  can be as big or as small as you like, even a single file. Express does
  not force you to use any specific ORM or template engine. With support for over
  14 template engines via [Consolidate.js](http://github.com/visionmedia/consolidate.js)
>>>>>>> FETCH_HEAD
  you can quickly craft your perfect framework.

## Viewing Examples

<<<<<<< HEAD
Clone the Express repo, then install the dev dependencies to install all the example / test suite dependencies:
=======
Clone the Express repo, then install the dev dependencies to install all the example / test suite deps:
>>>>>>> FETCH_HEAD

    $ git clone git://github.com/visionmedia/express.git --depth 1
    $ cd express
    $ npm install

<<<<<<< HEAD
Then run whichever tests you want:

    $ node examples/content-negotiation

You can also view live examples here:

<a href="https://runnable.com/express" target="_blank"><img src="https://runnable.com/external/styles/assets/runnablebtn.png" style="width:67px;height:25px;"></a>

## Running Tests

To run the test suite, first invoke the following command within the repo, installing the development dependencies:

    $ npm install

Then run the tests:
=======
then run whichever tests you want:

    $ node examples/content-negotiation

## Running Tests

To run the test suite first invoke the following command within the repo, installing the development dependencies:

    $ npm install

then run the tests:
>>>>>>> FETCH_HEAD

    $ make test
